page.title: 19HOUSING IN THURSTON
page.content: Thurston is in reality two villages which have merged into one .The oldest part is near the church.Some of the houses are farm cottages,while some were built to house workers on the railway in the 19th Century. There is a large amount of private housing in Thurston,with most of the houses being for first-time buyers and families.Most of these houses have been built since 1945,and are a mixture of bungalows and normal houses. There are some council houses and some old peoples bungalows. Many of those living in Thurston travel to work in Ipswich,Bury St. Edmunds,Newmarket,Stowmarket and Cambridge.
